instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
the board was liquid damaged, corrosion on the SMC area, thunderbolt area and i/o board flex cable. reflowed SMC and replaced any corroded ic. 
i/o board flex cable has been replaced.

after that board can turn on. passed ASD 100% no sensor error. but activity showing 300-600% CPU usage on Kernal Task. 

is it SMC, thunderbolt  or SD card i/o board at fault?? 

[img]https://i.imgur.com/mjK064O.jpg[/img]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/ie0vxko.jpg[/img]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message: is everything connected to the board? keyboard/trackpad/battery/flex cables? battery being detected and charging?

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message: Could still be crap under SMC or bad SMC. Also check all INA2** current sense chips for corroded pins as sometimes ASD will not pick that up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
replaced SMC and still have the same problem.

then replaced <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>, <CHIP>U5410</CHIP> and UD240. made no difference.

i have no idea ;(

however, Windows 10 is fast even with boot camp drivers. 



any way to see which kext driver in OSX causing it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
someone on other forum says don't believe ASD OSX. it has many bugs etc and has false failures.


can a bad ME region causes this?

i really want to get this board fixed, its an i7 as well.

the board works well on Windows 10, just not OSX nor safe mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
Run MRI and see if that turns up anything. ME should be ok if it passes the "chipset" test.

[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ENhq5La9sZ5BWTo0vqaNzAcTOdWWaQAg[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
i did swap the battery, old battery was liquid damaged.

[IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/cFo0lDY.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/iAD5OTV.jpg[/IMG]


charging, running off the battery, reading battery status in osx is good.


<RESISTOR>R5429</RESISTOR> = 300k, good
<RESISTOR>R5439</RESISTOR> = 45.4k, good


can it be ISL?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
Voltage pin15 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?
Also post <CAPACITOR>C5422</CAPACITOR> voltage.

002 at pins 17/18?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 39324"]Voltage pin15 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?
Also post <CAPACITOR>C5422</CAPACITOR> voltage.

002 at pins 17/18?[/QUOTE]


<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> - pin15 = 3.368v

i assume you mean <CAPACITOR>C7022</CAPACITOR>
pin1 = 16.53

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.404v


resistance between 17/18 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> = 7.60 ohms
resistance between 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> = 20.5 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
"[URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/isl6259ahrtz.html"]<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>[/URL] - pin15 = 3.368v"
Very bad, SMC receives overcurrent information into <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>...

"resistance between 17/18 of [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/isl6259ahrtz.html"]<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>[/URL] = 7.60 ohms"
Look at schematic and see the correct value.
Check <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>/51/52 and theyr traces; be sure to have good contact with <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.message:

Look at schematic and see the correct value.
Check <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>/51/52 and theyr traces; be sure to have good contact with <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.[/QUOTE]

yeah i am aware, 17/18 should around 3ohms. i'll check properly once i have time. very likely the ISL is bad. i've already replaced SMC when Duke asked me to.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message: How can the ISL cause a high reading between pins 17/18?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
pin2 of <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> did not connect to <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>. fixed with a jumper.

pins 17/18 of ISL now is 3.3 ohms

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin15 = 4.2v"


i haven't replace the ISL yet.


so the SMC from the donor has gone bad because the ISL has killed it?? Would I need to replace both together?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
Surelly good contact between ISL and <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52?
Also check if <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> has correct value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - super slow - 300-600% High CPU usage on Kernal Task
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> = 0.5 ohms. - good
isl has good contact between <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>
